synopsis.text:
Visual ize a world where the color of your attire dictates your societal status. In this town, a boy, clad in red and positioned at the lowest rung of society, crosses paths with a girl donning a deep blue school uniform while attending night school. Their eyes lock, triggering a shared memory of their first encounter.

Directed by Tazawa Ushio of GODÃ—DOG PRODUCTION, this award-winning indie animation unfolds a tale of subtle exchanges and profound connections. The girl, intrigued by the boy's wall scribbles, deciphers the hidden message. Her enigmatic smile, etched in the boy's memory, carries an unspoken significance.

In this brief yet poignant narrative, two individuals, consistently crossing paths yet seemingly worlds apart, find themselves intertwined in a story of color-based discrimination and silent understanding. Will the boy and girl transcend societal norms, or remain bound by them? Delve into this captivating Boy Meets Girl animation to uncover their journey.
